headline: Where Will Bristol Myers Squibb Be in 5 Years?
summary: Investors often look to major pharmaceutical stocks as an area that is likely to provide an anchor for their portfolios.  Consider Bristol Myers Squibb (NYSE: BMY), which has seen its shares rise just 2% over the past five years, seesawing back and forth over that time.  Its trailing-12-month operating expenses of $28.2 billion are substantially higher than its operating income of around $7.3 billion over that period.
